# sampleBuffer

**Instance Property**

A specialized memory buffer that the GPU uses to store its counter data during the resource state pass.

## Declaration

```swift
var sampleBuffer: (any MTLCounterSampleBuffer)? { get set }
```

## Discussion

The property defaults to `nil`, which means the GPU doesn’t save any GPU counter information during the resource state pass. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/creating-a-counter-sample-buffer-to-store-a-gpus-counter-data-during-a-pass] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/sampling-gpu-data-into-counter-sample-buffers].

## Configuring the sample buffer attachment

- **startOfEncoderSampleIndex**: The index the Metal device object should use to store GPU counters when starting the resource state pass.
- **endOfEncoderSampleIndex**: The index the Metal device object should use to store GPU counters when ending the resource state pass.
